product_name: GarnierMicellar Skinactive Gentle Peeling Water with 1% PHA & Glycolic Acid
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingThe Garnier Micellar Gentle Peeling Water with 1% PHA and Glycolic Acid, removes makeup and gently exfoliates skin. Use as an exfoliating facial cleanser in the morning and as a gentle makeup remover at night; can also be used as an exfoliating toner.
details: DetailsBenefitsA multi-purpose cleanser by Micellar Technology. Micelles work like a magnet to gently cleanse, while removing makeup, dirt, sunscreen, and excess oilFormula with 1 PERCENT PHA and Glycolic Acid. An expert formula with Micellar Water, 1 Percent PHA and Glycolic Acid improves skin smoothness and tone. Easily removes makeup without over drying skinUse as an exfoliating facial cleanser in the morning and as a gentle makeupAlll-in-1 cleanser to gently exfoliate for visibly healthy glowing skin.Item 2611325How To UsePour onto cotton pad until fully saturated. Gently wipe pad across face to cleanse and remove face makeup. To remove eye makeup, hold pad over closed eyelids for a few seconds, then gently wipe away. Use daily. No need to rinse. Try with Garnier Reusable SkinActive Micellar Cleansing Eco Pads. Suitable for use on face, lips and eyes. Avoid getting in eyes. If contact occurs, rinse thoroughly with water.DERMATOLOGIST & OPHTHALMOLOGIST TESTED FOR SAFETY: Safe for use on face, lips and eyes; Non-Comedogenic (won't clog pores); hydrates; Fragrance-Free formula: approved by Cruelty-Free International; no greasy residue.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Hexylene Glycol, Gluconolactone, Glycerin, Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract/Pineapple Fruit Extract, Papain, Glycolic Acid, Peg-32, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide, Coco-Betaine, Poloxamer 184, Disodium Edta, Propanediol, Polysorbate 20, Myrtrimonium Bromide.
how_to_use: Pour onto cotton pad until fully saturated. Gently wipe pad across face to cleanse and remove face makeup. To remove eye makeup, hold pad over closed eyelids for a few seconds, then gently wipe away. Use daily. No need to rinse. Try with Garnier Reusable SkinActive Micellar Cleansing Eco Pads. Suitable for use on face, lips and eyes. Avoid getting in eyes. If contact occurs, rinse thoroughly with water.DERMATOLOGIST & OPHTHALMOLOGIST TESTED FOR SAFETY: Safe for use on face, lips and eyes; Non-Comedogenic (won't clog pores); hydrates; Fragrance-Free formula: approved by Cruelty-Free International; no greasy residue.
ingredients: Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract/Pineapple Fruit Extract

reviews.headline: My go to for every day
reviews.comments: I love this micellar water, I use it daily. I love that it exfoliates gently and I can use it all over my face, even my eyes and lips. It's great at taking off makeup residue.

reviews.headline: I will continue buying this product
reviews.comments: I find this product to really clean my face of makeup so gently and completely.   Pleasant and refreshing.

reviews.headline: Bought this on a whim
reviews.comments: After major surgery, I've been re-learning my skin, which has been challenging. I never had breakouts, dark spots, flaking, or texture before. I started learning makeup to boost my confidence. I bought this product because I dislike makeup wipes and their scent. After using it on bare skin in the morning, it reduced flakiness. I follow up with moisturizer for hydration. Over two weeks, it has significantly improved my textured bumps and reduced breakouts. I believe the glycolic acid is effective. I love this product and use it as a cleanser in the morning rather than washing my face or makeup remover. (though I prefer a cleansing balm for extra effectiveness cause i feel it doesn't remove make up well) I'll definitely repurchase it. I know everyone's different, but it's worth trying if you're struggling with similar concerns.

reviews.headline: Nice salicylic micellar.
reviews.comments: it works as a nice makeup remover, but with it having salicylic, I wouldn't personally recommend it for around the eye use. It doesn't cause any over drying does the job as most micellar waters do. It has a decent price point for the bottle size and the bottle in informative.

reviews.headline: Rash/bumps
reviews.comments: Good at removing makeupe but after using it for a few days my face began to burn when using it. I have a bunch of bumps on my face and redness. Beware if you have sensitive skin or eczema :)

reviews.headline: For years the garnier micellar waters have been my go to!
Not safe for sensitive skin!
reviews.comments: I bought this because my skin has become more breakout-prone recently and i thought it would help. When i only used it once a week or so, it was ok for cleansing but didn't do anything else. I tried using it more often, and as soon as i used it two nights in a row, my skin broke out in a rash. It started out as a red, irritated patch over the bridge of my nose and spread out over my face over the next week or so, even after i stopped using this product that first day. It's been about 2-3 weeks now and my skin is still itchy, flaky, and irritated. My skin barrier is totally shot and i can't use any actives at all, even gentle ones, without more irritation and burning. Stick to the vitamin c version if you want some sort of active. I used that one every night for about a year with no issues at all. Doesn't clear skin, though.

reviews.headline: Amazed by the results!
reviews.comments: I started wearing sunscreen last year and noticed a lot of dark spots from acne. Ive tried a lot of AHA and BHA products in the past that were far too harsh and caused painful breakouts. This was perfect! After one use I noticed a nice glow the next morning, and after a full week my acne is coming to the surface but isnt flared and irritated. My skin looks so dewy. The best part- I already notice my dark spots fading! I can't recommend it enough.

reviews.headline: Definitely recommend!
reviews.comments: This made my face smooth and its super hydrating. It got rid of my acne and it smells very good.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I was excited dto try this micellar Water with added benefits of 1%PHA & Glycolic Acid by Garneir. I love that the brand is Cruelty Free certified thru Leaping Bunny as well as being vegan. The packaging is also made from 100% recycled plastic, so yes, I was on board to see how well it worked.

Everytime I've tried a makeup remover like this, it's left my skin feeling sticky, not very clean and almost everytime, I still end up using my regular face wash and water. However, Garnier has changed the game with this one! This micellar water is so easy to use and my skin actually feels refreshed post use! I have been using it as a first step cleanse when I don't have time or don't feel like going thru an oil or a balm cleanse. I also have been using it to wipe off mistakes when doing my makeup. I'm really impressed with the ability to cleanse with minor rubbing. I hate rubbing my eyelashes to get mascara off of them, I feel it leads to lash loss. This is a simple pout on reusable cotton round & press onto skin. I wipe it away with a clean cloth and my makeup is GONE. I do use a gel cleanser after this, mainly because I wear sunscreen and want to make sure everything is off my face for the night. But it's been really nice to not go thru the hassle, cost & blurry vision that some balms or oils can cause. 

I'd definitely recommend this to any makeup enthusiasts as well as any MUA, it gets makeup swatches off really easily (yes, even eyeliner!).

The only thing I don't like is the dispensing method. I love a pump style dispenser for easier,  hands free use and it is more convenient on the go or for traveling when time/space is limited.
faceoff_positive.headline: This is the best Micellar Water I've ever tried!

faceoff_negative.comments: I love trying out new skincare products and was very hopeful for the All-In-1 Micellar Gentle Peeling Water. Unfortunately for me, I did not find this to live up to the all-in-1 cleanse, remove and exfoliate. I used this on a cotton swab, and while it definitely takes off some of my makeup, harder to remove makeup like mascara, liner and eye gel does not budge. I think this would be more useful as part of a double cleanse to remove any foundation or powders from the face or as a morning wash when you need a light cleansing before makeup application. I did find this formula to be very gentle, so if you have had problems with stronger glycolic acids I would recommend trying this less harsh formula. I will continue to use as part of a double cleanse, but unlikely will repurchase because I find other products better suited for my personal needs.
faceoff_negative.headline: Just Okay
